column5: This curation contains films that I consider masterpieces of cinema throughout all ages and genres. Only films & shorts are included in this list. Films are sorted by release date in descending order. All films include one or more of the following criteria: 1. Mastery in Direction and Writing The film is masterfully directed and written, showcasing exceptional storytelling and film-making craftsmanship. 2. Authentic Portrayal of Human Experience The film captures various facets of the human experience with unparalleled accuracy, making them relatable and thought-provoking. 3. Timelessness and Ageless Appeal The film is considered timeless or has aged exceptionally well, to the point of sometimes transcending time itself. This can be due to the topics in question, the aesthetic quality, the acting, the cameras used, the composition techniques, or a combination of multiple factors. 4. Visual Excellence The film is visually stunning, boasting breathtaking cinematography and aesthetics that enhance the overall viewing experience or can even create the full experience (style over substance). 5. Exceptional Soundtrack The film features outstanding soundtracks that skillfully complement and enhance the scenes, creating a harmonious & coherent audio-visual experience. 6. Masterful Acting The film features performances of the highest caliber, with actors and actresses delivering compelling and convincing portrayals. The actors and actresses in these films are extremely convincing in their respective roles, adding authenticity to the narratives. 7. Emotional Impact The film provokes strong emotions, whether positive, negative, or a complex blend, leaving a lasting impression on the viewer. 8. Intellectual, Artistic, and Emotional Sophistication The film exhibits intellectual, artistic, and emotional depth, providing a profound viewing experience. 9. Historical Significance The film is considered a staple in depicting or playing a pivotal role in the most relevant historical moments. 10. Cultural & Historical Authenticity The film depicts specific cultures & time-frames with authenticity, offering a window into the richness and diversity of human societies. 11. Innovative Storytelling The film pushes the boundaries of traditional storytelling, exploring unique and inventive narrative techniques. 12. Boldness The film is bold and includes topics or scenes that are difficult to depict. 13. Respect for the Audience The film is smart enough as not to underestimate the audience, providing stimulating ideas, and letting the public think for themselves. 14. Cultural Impact The film has left a lasting mark on the cultural landscape, influencing subsequent generations of filmmakers, artists, and even society as a whole. It has become a touchstone for discussions, references, and interpretations that extend beyond its initial release, showcasing its enduring cultural relevance.

column2: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
Portrait of a Lady on Fire
A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night
